sections.PURPOSE: Bull Troop empowers small unit leaders to deliberately plan, resource, and execute decentralized squad level training nested within quarterly Troop training guidance.
sections.KEY TASKS:
1) Disciplined preparation IAW the 8-step training model.
2) Reference & incorporate most current doctrine for material to be trained.
3) Leaders certify trainees through incorporation of a doctrinal evaluation and record results.
4) Integrate one communications platform from SQDN PACE to report departure, training evaluation results, and return from training site.
5) Backbrief CO/1SG NLT T+6

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
ACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions

No crews will be outside of vehicles while firing or maneuvering.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Range OIC/RSOs provide oversight and supervision over the ranges, making sure that all operations follow the appropriate safety precautions. The Tactical OPORDs and CONOPs will reflect a scenario supporting safe maneuver. The range has an RSO and constant access to the range tower radio and telephone to contact the Range Control Firing Desk and 7ATC as appropriate. In the event of a real word MEDEVAC event on site, Safeties and Training Support Personnel are responsible for ceasing fire on the range and communication directly with the OIC/RSO of the range to coordinate MEDEVAC. SUAS subject matter expert will be present during sUAS Operations.
